alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 11:20PM MDT until May 29 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Colorado... Yampa River near Maybell affecting Moffat County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Yampa River near Maybell. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The boat ramp in the Maybell Bridge Campground/Yampa River Access Point is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM MDT Thursday, May 25 the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river has dropped to 9.5 feet Sunday, May 28. It will continue to fall to 9.0 feet Tuesday, May 30. It will rise to 9.5 feet Wednesday, May 31. It will remain close to, but below action stage for the coming week. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Yampa River Maybell 12.0 9.5 Sun 10 pm MD 9.5 9.4 9.3 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
